message: Key distinctions identified: Psychodynamic focuses on PAST (childhood trauma), UNCONSCIOUS conflicts, INSIGHT goal, and therapist as INTERPRETER. Humanistic focuses on PRESENT/FUTURE, CONSCIOUS control, GROWTH goal, and therapist as FACILITATOR with 3 core attributes.

data.common_confusion: genuineness vs being friendly/nice - genuineness is CONSISTENCY between feeling and behavior, not just being pleasant

message: Generated 4 psychodynamic vs humanistic questions: (1) Application scenario - childhood trauma exploration vs growth (psychodynamic for past/unconscious), (2) Tricky role distinction - therapist as interpreter vs facilitator, (3) Tricky genuineness definition - congruence vs being nice/agreeable, (4) Application identifying person-centered by rejection of interpretation. All follow existing JSON format with detailed explanations.
